body.p: We the undersigned petitioners would respectfully represent to fineyour excellency Governor Bramlette, that at the Novr term 1863 of the Owen Circuit Court a verdict was rendered against them for the sum of twenty dollars each and twenty seven dollars & 45 cents costs - that they are young men, and imprudently engaged in a game at cards, that they were not in the habit of gaming are poor men, one of them us having a family to support, and the other very low and feble, with ill health - We ask his excellency to remit that part of the fine to which the Commonwealth is entitled-
John A. Wakes & S W Burton

We the neighbors of the above petitioners would represent that the above statements we believe to be true, that the young men are quiet & worthy young men & the case once in which in which executive clemency could be
very properly used - we unite with the petitioners and ask that the fine be remitted as in duty bound we ever pray &c -

May 2nd 1864 - P. H. Smith
G. R. Lee
Ben F. Sidebottom
M H Sandford CLK
of Owen Circuit Court
John A Moore D. C.
of Owen County
George L. Ford
